subject: Re: [junit] Re: Problems running JUnit

Hi Magnus,

On 10/20/06, t703093 <t703093@...> wrote:
> My path looks like this:
>
>  C:\Programfiler\Java\jdk1.5.0_03
>  \bin;c:\Perl\bin;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32
>  \Wbem;c:\xalan\xalan-j_2_7_0\xml-apis.jar;c:\xalan\xalan-j_2_7_0
>  \xercesImpl.jar.;C:\Programfiler\IDM Computer Solutions\UltraEdit-
>  32;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32
>  \Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\DPDrv;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\Syste
>  m32\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\DPDrv;C:\junit4.1\junit-4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;

Note that you don't need to include your .jar files and source folders
in PATH. They're just polluting your environment for no benefit
whatsoever.


On 10/20/06, t703093 <t703093@...> wrote:
>  and my classpath looks like this:
>
>  C:\Ifi\Java\easyIO.jar;C:\junit4.1\junit-
>  4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;C:\Ifi\Java;;.

Looks good: you've got the junit.jar in there.


On 10/20/06, t703093 <t703093@...> wrote:
>  I can run javac with these settings, but not junit.
>
>  still problems and the same error:
>  NoClassDefFoundError: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore

How about if you set the classpath explicitly like this:

java -classpath
C:\Ifi\Java\easyIO.jar;C:\junit4.1\junit-4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;C:\Ifi\Java;.
org.junit.runner.JUnitCore

-Lasse-
